message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.CC 

The paper deals with the storage-repair-bandwidth tradeoff of regenerating codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also involves the analysis of algorithms and data structures used in regenerating codes (cs.DS), as well as the design and analysis of network protocols for data storage and retrieval (cs.NI). The paper may also be relevant to the field of systems and control theory (cs.SI) due to its focus on optimizing the performance of distributed storage systems. Finally, the paper may be relevant to the field of computational complexity (cs.CC) due to its analysis of the computational complexity of regenerating codes.
